Description: Mould-made pottery lamp-stand modelled in the form of a figure of Bes, wearing lion-skin over shoulders and hanging down his back. He has a cap with curled lappets on each side, above which is a moulded crown to which the lamp was attached; a narrow stem which supported the lamp is broken away. The figure stands on a low, square plinth, with applied stubs of clay within its hollowed base to ensure the object stands securely level. Brown clay covered with an orange-red slip. Plaster mould.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1980)
Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C592)
